column4: And I still don't "get" what makes synaptic better than add/remove.
What's the advantage of synaptic?  Best I can tell is simply access to more repos.
libs?  libraries? What's an example of when you'd need to do this?
Me being a n00b, I guess add/remove is the right thing to use.
Yeah, I've seen dev packages in there.
So Add/Remove was included in Ubuntu for idiots like me, while smart people across the Linuxverse appreciate the power of Synaptic.  Is that about right?
When you run an "updatedb" what exactly is happening?
an index of your filesystem is created
apt-cache search::: search for packages   apt-cache show:: show a specific package (sudo not necessary for either)
sudo apt-get blahblah,   gksudo gedit, gksudo totem etc
when you do ctrl-alt-f1 for example, you go to a console (tty - teletype terminal) --- try it.. come back here with ctrl-alt-f7
no prob, the tty is terminology from old times
the are numbered tty1 tty2, etc. like when you do ctrl-alt-f2, or f3
